metadata.title: CVE-2021-30534 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in iFrameSandbox in Google Chrome prior to91.0.4472.77 allowed a remote attacker to bypass navigation restrictionsvia a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30534` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
